column1: na igomang de nitai
column2: Night Visitors

column1: images:do-upasama.png:"bawi, yu du yau putaupa e?",odisa-igo.png:"sikwai so ni, sikwai so lamali",wikuliboi-mlem.png:"i wikuliboi, i du sekwai nau",wanglamau.png:"i du bi e mau?",wikuliboi-langko.png
odisa du yo maukai so wi.
column2: Odis has a little cat door.

column1: kagu de i ne dabau, gewai i du yau dai maukai du go tu ne, du ka kagu de i.
column2: His food is inside the house, so he has to use the cat door to go inside and eat his food.

column1: natai, odisa du ka wina kagu, dana tai.
column2: normally, Odis eats a small amount of food many times a day.

column1: yo tai, mi du meng i wating du ka wano kagukwai!
column2: Sometimes, I think he only eats ten kibbles!

column1: geng nutai mi du si, kagu de i du go nosi so kwi!
column2: but recently, I have seen that his food has disappeared very quickly!

column1: laiting, mi du si kabau de i no du bi ne lu so natai, geng du bi winai maukai.
column2: Also, I see that his bowl is not in its normal place, but instead is close to the cat door.

column1: mi yau du bu we du pumeng, e du swadu!
column2: I have to figure out a way to learn what is happening!

column1: gewai, mi du obu app so du nang mi du du naise de mi tu siduting.
column2: So i found an app that lets me make my phone into a camera.

column1: mi du lu do naise winai maukai, du kunokai maukai, lai du lubi tu du si e be du swadu.
column2: I put two phones near the cat door, locked the cat door, and waited to see what would happen.

column1: betai, mi du pingtai.
column2: afterwards, I went to sleep.

column1: a nitai, dana ting du swadu!
column2: Many things happened that night!

column1: na wa ting du swadu witai be menitai.
column2: The first thing happened shortly after midnight.

column1: mau so wanglayang du swasi!
column2: An orange cat appeared!

column1: mi ya du sa ne i lu wano daswetai, geng i du bi na wa tai so mi du si i mau.
column2: I have lived here for ten years, but this is my first time seeing this cat.

column1: na do ting du bi, wikuliboi du swasi!
column2: The second thing was that a raccoon appeared!

column1: i du oka kagu de odisa.
column2: He ate up Odis' food.

column1: pauting, odisa swa du swasi.
column2: Finally, Odis himself appeared.

column1: kagu so nosi, maukai so nokai.
column2: The food was gone, the cat door was closed.

column1: i du si so kebegameng.
column2: He looked disappointed.

column1: na omeng so da
column2: Big decisions

column1: images:odisa-ba-lobau.png:"du loka laiting no du loka?"
odisa du bi mang so du yo dana omeng so dawe.
column2: Odis is someone who has many important decisions.

column1: o nutai i du tau tu ta yotingpingting.
column2: Every morning he jumps onto the table.

column1: ta yotingpingting du yo do lobau de lo.
column2: There are two cups of water on the table.

column1: o do du bi lo tu mau.
column2: Both of them are water for the cat.

column1: odisa du tau, du ogo tu me i do bau.
column2: Odis jumps and arrives in-between these two cups.

column1: i du si tu wa bau.
column2: He looks at one cup.

column1: betai, i du si tu lai bau.
column2: Then, he looks at the other cup.

column1: i du meng so da ku, po dono wiwitai.
column2: He thinks very hard, maybe for 20 seconds.

column1: so pau, i du omeng.
column2: In the end, he decides.

column1: i kai du loka lo de wa lobau.
column2: He starts to drink from one cup.

column1: wina wiwitai be, i du nogo, du laitu to, du loka de lai lobau.
column2: A few seconds later, he stops, turns his head, and drinks from the other cup.

column1: i swadu du lailai mena witai.
column2: This phenomenon continues for several minutes.

column1: mi du emeng so da, i mau du meng e ting.
column2: I really wonder what this cat is thinking.

column1: i du omeng e we??
column2: How does he decide??

column1: i du meng e ting??
column2: What is he thinking about??

column1: i du bu e ting?
column2: What is he looking for?

column1: i du obu e na pauting?
column2: What conclusions does he reach?

column1: na mau du ge mina dana kumeng.
column2: Cats give us much knowledge.

column1: geng ne i biting, mi no du kumeng, i du ge mina e kumeng.
column2: But in this case, I don't know what knowledge he has given us.

column1: so da yodanating
column2: Very busy

column1: images:odisa-pingtai.png:"i mau du pingtai",odisa-gali.png:"i mau du pingtai ta mi"
du yo tai so odisa so gali so da, du ping lu su, du nang mang du pingpi i.
column2: Sometimes, Odis is very happy and lies on the ground, allowing people to pat him.

column1: geng lai na tai, i mau du yo ting so dawe so i dwa du.
column2: But other times, he has important things he has to do.

column1: i na tai, yu lailai nang bu du pingpi i.
column2: These times, you can still try to touch him.

column1: no du bi biting, so i no yau yu du i ting.
column2: It's not the case that he doesn't want you to do this.

column1: geng dapo so i no be pau du kogo.
column2: But it's likely he won't stop walking.

column1: tai i du yo ting so dawe so i dwa du, i no du yo tai du lai ting.
column2: When he has important things to do, he doesn't have time for other things.

column1: yu no dwa du nogali bi i no du nogo.
column2: You shouldn't be sad if he doesn't stop.

column1: i mau du bi boi so yodanating.
column2: This cat is a busy animal.

column1: mi swa no du kumeng i dwa du e na ting!
column2: I myself don't know what things he needs to do!

column1: geng ina dwa du bi so dawe so da.
column2: But they must be very important.

column1: bi yu yau so da du pingpi i, yu nang du dai wigaka du deli i du igo.
column2: If you want to touch him, you can use a treat to entice him to come.

column1: yau
column2: desires

column1: yo tai so odisa du swasi, du sang so dana.
column2: Sometimes, Odis appears and meows a lot.

column1: de i tai, i so gwa du si i du yau e ting.
column2: Some of these times, it is easy to see what he wants.

column1: lai na tai, yu du ge ka tu i, yu du pingpi i, geng i lailai du sang.
column2: Other times, you give him food, you pat him, but he continues to meow.

column1: i du yau e ting?
column2: What does he want?

column1: i swa du yau ting e?
column2: Do they even want anything?

column1: so po, i nomai du li yau so opo ne salokwai de i.
column2: Maybe, he feels a general desire inside his heart.

column1: no du bi yau so walu, nomai du bi li so opo.
column2: It's not a specific desire, just a general feeling.

column1: mau du li ting so opo, gewai du sang.
column2: The cat feels something, and therefore meows.

column1: so danatai, mitwiboi du bi so wawe.
column2: Often, humans are the same.

column1: laiwe swa du bi, bi mitwiboi du li ting, mina so o tai du dwemeng so du kumeng wai du bi e ting.
column2: The difference only is, when a human feels something, we always think we know what the reason is.

column1: tai swa mitwiboi du li ting, mitwiboi du bu wai.
column2: As soon as a human feels something, they look for a reason.

column1: geng i wai so mina du obu natai no du bi wai so dwe.
column2: But this reason is usually not the true reason.

column1: tai mina du li so noga, mina dwa du pumeng e we du se tu mang so dama, swa bi mina no du kumeng wai du li i we.
column2: When we feel bad, we must learn how to talk to our loved ones, even if we do not know why we are feeling this way.

column1: badu bamang
column2: Project partners

column1: images:lisa-ba-mama.png:"du si ba!"
daswetai 2015, mi du kai umastersdegree.
column2: In 2015, I startd my master's degree.

column1: na wa kwaikwa, wa de mi batai du bi "CS224W: swaduting-pumeng de lengdanakwai"
column2: In the first quarter, one of my classes was CS224W: machine learning for graphs.

column1: i batai du go so ga.
column2: That class went well.

column1: geng, tai badu so pau de mina, mi du yo nogating so wi.
column2: But when it was time for our final project, I had a small problem.

column1: badu so pau du yau yu du kudu ba bamang.
column2: the final project required that one work with a project partner.

column1: ne i batai, mi no du yo dana mamang.
column2: in that class I didn't have many friends.

column1: laiting, na mamang so mi du kumeng, ya du yo bamang de swa.
column2: What's more, the friends I knew already their own project partners.

column1: gewai, mi yau bu bamang!
column2: Therefore, I needed to find a partner!

column1: mi du go tu lilenglu de batai, du mo namo:
column2: I went to the class website and wrote a post:

column1: mi du yau pau-badu bamang, mi ya du batai de lailai, du bi so dameng, lailai
column2: I am looking for a final project partner, I have done such-and-such classes, I'm smart, etc."

column1: bataimang so mi no du kumeng du laise i namo.
column2: A classmate I didn't know answered the post.

column1: geng, witai be i du laise mi, ting so ta ga du swadu:
column2: But before he answered me, a better thing happened:

column1: mamang so lai de mi, kalala, du se mamang de i lai du bi ne i batai, nang du kudu ba mi.
column2: Another friend of me, Clara, said that her friend was also in this class, and could work with me.

column1: i mamang du swase lisa;  mi ya du kumeng i so wi.
column2: Her name was Lisa, and I already knew her a bit.

column1: awe du kai so dwedwe mamangtai de lisa ba mi.
column2: Thus started the friendship between me and Lisa in earnest.

column1: mina du kumeng so wi, mina no swa du obu batai de bamang, geng laiting sa de bamang
column2: Little did we know that we did not just find class partners, but also life partners.

column1: se so dwe: tadwemang de aisaka
column2: A true story: the god of Isaac

column1: tai mi du go tu ayalang, go de mi so langku.
column2: When I went to Ireland, my journey was arduous.

column1: mi dwa du nopingtai nutai so tamai, du go so pingtai tu kigolu.
column2: I had to wake up too early and go sleepily to the airport.

column1: kigo de mi du yo do kwai.
column2: My flight had two parts.

column1: kwai na wa no du yo nogating.
column2: The first one was problem-free.

column1: geng kwai na do be du igo so nonutai.
column2: But the second one was going to come late.

column1: mi dwa du laiwe kwai na do.
column2: I had to change the second part.

column1: mi du go lepingting, du se ‚Äúyu nang du laiwe kigo de mi e?‚Äù
column2: I went to the counter and said: "Can you change my flight?"

column1: a du se: ‚Äúmina du kudu i kigo, geng yu du dai lai kigolena du bemengtai i kigo. gewai, mi no nang du laiwe kigo de yu."
column2: They said: "We operate this flight, but you booked this flight with another airline company. Therefore, I can't change your flight."

column1: mi du nogaliki, du laiwe bo, du kogo tu lai kigolukwai.
column2: I sighed, turned around, and walked to the other terminal.

column1: tai mi du ogo lai kigolukwai, mi du twase tu ina, biting de mi du bi e.
column2: When I arrived at the other terminal, I explained to those guys what my situation was.

column1: ina du se: ‚Äúso da nogali, mina no nang du gage yu.‚Äù
column2: They said: "Sorry, we can't help you."

column1: wating a mang so du kudu i kigo nang du laiwe kigo. mina no nang du ting.‚Äù
column2: Only the people who operate this flight cab change the flight. We can't do anything.

column1: mi du se: ‚Äúgeng ana du se no nang du!‚Äù
column2: I said: "But they said they can't do it!"

column1: ina du se: ‚Äúana so eli. du obu mang so ta lenonu ba‚Äù
column2: These guys said: "Those guys are confused. Find a more senior person."

column1: mi du kogo tu kigolukwai na wa. tai de i winai wano witai.
column2: I walked to terminal 1. This took around ten minutes.

column1: yu nang du ese, ina du se e ting tu mi‚Ä¶.
column2: You can guess what these guys told me....

column1: dwe, ina du se tu mi, mi dwa du go kigolukwai na do, ese ana.
column2: Correct, they told me I have to go to terminal 2 and ask them.

column1: tai mi lai du ogo kigolukwai na do, swawe ina du se so dali, ‚Äúmina no nang du.‚Äù
column2: When I got to terminal 2 again, naturally they said firmly: "we can't do this".

column1: i tai, mi so kulimeng mi no be du nodu so wawe.
column2: This time, I was determined not to make the same mistake.

column1: mi du se: ‚Äúyu nang du ge naise na de yu tu mi, gewai mi nang du ge tu ana, yu do nang du se laiswa?‚Äù
column2: I said: "Can you give me your phone number, so I can give it to them and the two of you can talk to each other?"

column1: no nogating! i du bi i lu‚Äù	No problem! Here it is."
so pauting mi so gali, du meng mi nang du si we tu none i bi.
column2: Finally I felt happy; I thought I could see a way out of this situation.

column1: mi du kogo so swadali tu lemang lu lepingting, du ge laise-na tu i.
column2: I proudly walked up to the officer at the counter and gave her the number.

column1: laitai du bi mi! geng i tai yu nang du naise tu lai lemang!‚Äù	Me again! But now you can phone the other officer!"
i du galisang, no swa du si kwai de ping ne kopau de mi.
column2: She laughed, and did not even look at the piece of paper in my hand.

column1: kakaka mi no be du a‚Äù	Hahaha I'm not gonna do that"
mi so nitwanogali.
column2: I was despairing.

column1: no du kumeng e du.
column2: I didn't know what to do.

column1: wating nang du wa ting: du naise mamang de mi so danangdu, lisa.
column2: I could only do one thing: phone my very capable friend, Lisa.

column1: ting so dwe, lisa lai go du kigo tu ayalang a baitai.
column2: Lisa was actually also flying to Ireland that day.

column1: i du gage mi, du lu mi ne kigo so wawe de i.
column2: She helped me and put me in the same flight as her.

column1: tai i du ogo kigolu, i du obu mi so ping lu su.
column2: When she arrived at the airport, she found me lying on the floor.

column1: i du ge bau de swangbaugu tu mi.
column2: She gave me sourdough bread.

column1: tai swa mi du si i, mi so gali.
column2: As soon as I saw this/her, I was happy.

column1: lisa du go twa lisilu, geng mi lailai dwa du pu dupinglu.
column2: Lisa went through security, but I still needed to get a seat.

column1: lemang de kigo du ese mi: ‚Äúyu yau du subo sai lemu de yu?‚Äù
column2: The flight officer asked me: "Do you want to sit next to your wife?"

column1: dwe ba‚Äù mi du se.	Yes please," I said.
mi no du se tu lemang so lisa no du bi lemu de mi.
column2: I did not tell the officer that Lisa was not my wife.

column1: mina du subo sai laiswa o kigo, so da gali.
column2: We sat very happily next to each other the whole flight.

column1: a baitai, dana ting so noga du swadu.
column2: That day, many bad things happened.

column1: geng pauting so da ga.
column2: But the result was very good.

column1: i tai swa, mina du swase i twi de biting ‚Äútadwemang de aisaka ‚Äú
column2: Now, we call this kind of phenomenon "the god of Isaac".

column1: nokwekwepe
column2: Random Coping Chess

column1: images:nkkp-posed.png,nkkp-teba-aisaka.png,nkkp-lamang-lasiba.png,nkkp-tesa-alang.png,nkkp-teba.png,nkkp-kangpu.png,nkkp-lamang.png,
tai mi du bi ne dapumenglu, mi du sa ne dabaukwai ba lai mang.
column2: When i was at university, I lived in a room with another person.

column1: i lai mang du swase lamang.
column2: This person's name was Raman.

column1: i du bi mamang so winai de mi.
column2: He was a close friend of mine.

column1: do pingtailu de mina du bi lu sai laiswa.
column2: Our two beds were side-by-side.

column1: mina du pingtai ne tu so gengwe: to de mi lu gokopau de i; gokopau de i lu to de mi.
column2: We slept in opposite directions: my head was at his feet and his feet were at my head.

column1: tai mina kai du pingtai, mina du se meng tu laiswa so mina du meng so yaumeng.
column2: As we fell asleep, we would talk to each other about the ideas that we found interesting.

column1: wa nitai so i, mina du nubi pe.
column2: One such night, we invented a game.

column1: mina ma du pe kwepe.
column2: We liked to play chess.

column1: geng a tai o mina kai du meng, kwepe no mai so da pe.
column2: But both of us had started to feel that chess wasn't that fun anymore.

column1: bi mina du nonawa, du meng swa no so dameng.
column2: If we lost, we felt like we were not intelligent.

column1: laiting, kwepe no so sa so dwe.
column2: Also, chess is not like real life.

column1: sa so dwe du yo dana ting so nonangbesi.
column2: Real life has many unpredicatable events.

column1: pauting, kwepe so ta nopeli.
column2: Finally, chess is too serious.

column1: sa so dwe ya so ta nopeli.
column2: Real life is already too serious.

column1: mina du yau pe de mina o du bi so peli!
column2: We want our games to be all fun!

column1: gewai, mina du nubi pe so nu, so swase "nokwekwepe".
column2: Therefore, we invented a new game called "Random Coping Chess".

column1: nokwekwepe du kai so wawe tu kwepe
column2: Random Coping Chess starts out like chess.

column1: geng na le de pe kai du laiwe so nokwi.
column2: But the rules of the game slowly begin to change.

column1: po, swegwadi du swadu, o pekwai de yu du gwadi tu wa sai de pingting.
column2: Maybe a landslide happens, and all your pieces slide to one side of the board.

column1: laiting koyote du swasi, du ting so nokwe so opo.
column2: Or a coyote appears and wreaks general havoc.

column1: mina du meng i meng du bi meng so pe so da, du pingtai so gali.
column2: We thought this was a very fun idea, and went to sleep happily.

column1: baitai so be, mina du se i meng tu lai na mamang.
column2: the next day, we told other friends about this idea.

column1: wa mamang, teba, du ma i meng so walu.
column2: one friend, Trevor, espcially liked this idea.

column1: mi dapo du noyameng i meng, bi no du bi dasali de i.
column2: I would probably have forgotten about this idea were it not for his enthusiasm.

column1: wina nitabai be, na mamang de lamang du yo baibai bamangting tu i.
column2: A few months later, Raman's friends had a goodbye party for him.

column1: ya i bamangting, teba bemeng du du nokwekwepe tu dweting.
column2: Before this party, Trevor planned to make Random Coping Chess a reality.

column1: i ba aisaka du nubi google slide ting, kai du nubi pingpeting tu pe.
column2: He and Isaac made a Google Slide deck and started making cards for the game.

column1: geng teba so nose du tuli i na pingpeting.
column2: But Trevor secretly printed these cards.

column1: i du kaili o mang de a lu!
column2: This surprised everyone there!

column1: tai so be, lamang go du sa lu sai so tudo de lelu.
column2: Afterwards, Raman went off to live on the east coast of the country.

column1: geng nokwekwepe no du pau.
column2: But Random Coping Chess did not die.

column1: ting so dwe, i ya du kai so swa.
column2: In fact, it was only just beginning.

column1: a daswetai, teba du go o baitai du si aisaka, du pe i pe.
column2: That year, Trevor came every day to see Isaac and play this game.

column1: dasali de teba so dukwang, du ge aisaka li so wawe.
column2: Trevor's enthusiasm was infectious, and gave Isaac the same energy.

column1: aisaka du kai o baitai du nubi pepingting so nu.
column2: Isaac started making new cards every day.

column1: tai i kai du pingtai, tai i du donosaigoting tu kudulu, i nomai du meng nokwekwepe.
column2: As he was falling asleep, as he was biking to work, he only thought about Random Coping Chess.

column1: o de sengtai, aisaka du begameng sengtaipau, tai i nang du pe wa pe so kwa metai lang.
column2: The whole week, Isaac was looking forward to the weekend, when he could play a single, four-hour long game.

column1: aisaka du meng, i du bi po so watwi du meng so ku lai du eta, geng tai so watwi du noleng o swadali de i.
column2: Isaac thought that this was a unique opportunity to think hard and compete, but at the same time let go of his pride.

column1: teba du se so danatai, du meng i ting nang du gemeng, ewe du koyo na ting so nokwe so ku so du swadu ne sa de mang.
column2: Trevor often said that he thought this can teach how to cope with the random and difficult things that happen in one's life.

column1: aisaka du ma i meng, geng du wipomeng i nang du i ting so dwedwe.
column2: Isaac liked this idea, but was uncertain that this could actually do this.

column1: geng aisaka no du kumeng so a tai swa, teba du sa swadu so ku so da.
column2: But Isaac didn't know then that at that very time, Trevor was experiencing an extremely difficult event.

column1: muda de i atai swa du nosa.
column2: His mother had just died.

column1: i pe so dawe tu aisaka.
column2: This game was important to Isaac.

column1: geng i pe so ta dawe tu teba.
column2: But this game was more important to Trevor.

column1: mina du bi ilu itai tu se de sesowi, twi de se so nu.
column2: We're here today to discuss Sesowi, a new sort of language.

column1: yuna nang du se mi, i se du bi e we?
column2: Can you tell me what this language is like?

column1: na, sesowi du bi se so winakwai.
column2: Well, Sesowi is a very simple language.

column1: mowe de i so winakwai, sewe de i so winakwai
column2: Its grammar is very simple and its pronunciation is very simple.

column1: wating du yo wawapai kaisekwai.
column2: There are only 115 root words.

column1: o lai sekwai, o lai mengting, du dai i wawapai kai-sekwai du bo swa.
column2: All other words, all other concepts, are formed of these 115 root words.

column1: na, yu be du se, i se so noku du pumeng e?
column2: So would you say, this language is easy to learn?

column1: na dwe, i se so da noku du pumeng.
column2: yes, this language is very easy to learn!

column1: du yo lai se so mang du nubi.
column2: There are other languages that people have created.

column1: ina laiting so noku du pumeng.
column2: They are also easy to learn.

column1: geng, ina no so odating.

column1: nekoting, du meng esepelangtose, lai idose, ingtalingwese, ingtalingwase, lingwa di pwaneta se, lailai.
column2: For example, consider Esperanto, or Interlingue, or Interlingua, or Lingwa di Planeta, or Ido, etc.

column1: ina o so noku du pumeng....

column1: wating muse de yu de elopa.

column1: biting muse de yu du bi sinose, lai basabalise, lai benggalise, ina so ku so da!
column2: If your mother tongue is Chinese, or Balinese, or Bengali, they are very hard!

column1: swa swase de ina so ku du se!

column1: laiting, sesowi du sang so nangma!

column1: mi du dwemeng,

column1: du se se dwa du galitobe mang.

column1: esemang: na, pautu de yuna du bi okuli odating e?

column1: bi yu du meng so ga, odating ya du sa okuli.

column1: mang no du koyo lai mang.

column1: i nokoyo ya du okuli mina.

column1: sesowi du ge mina nangdu so nu du koyo laiswa.

column1: geng, odating de se o so laiwe so da.
column2: The world's languages are all so different.

column1: ewe nang du yo se so noku du pumeng tu o mang?

column1: yu du se so dwe, odating de se no du yo dana so bayo.

column1: noting 'mama', no du yo swa wa sekwai so o se du bayo.

column1: gewai, mina du dai sekwai so wi du nubi mengting so danakwai.
